alert.note: Alert for Jackson (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 02 at 6:35PM CST until February 03 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Houston/Galveston TX has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Texas... Lavaca River near Edna affecting Jackson County. For the Lavaca River...including Komensky, Breslau, Hallettsville, Edna...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Lavaca River near Edna. * WHEN...From this evening to early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 21.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding begins with flow backing through peripheral channels adjacent to the river and reaches into sloughs and low areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:15 PM CST Wednesday the stage was 21.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:15 PM CST Wednesday was 21.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight and continue falling to 6.2 feet Monday evening. - Flood stage is 21.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 21.4 feet on 07/27/2007. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (6 pm CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat Lavaca River Edna 21.0 21.4 Wed 6 pm CST 16.9 11.5 8.6 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Thursday morning at 645 AM CST.
